page.title: 10BRINSWORTH SWITCHING STATION
page.content: The{Central Electricity Generating {Board (C.E.G.B.)}runs the{Brinsworth {Switching Station.}It is built on{ {Canklow Meadows}on spare ground away from houses to keep people safe. For {security}it has{remote control cameras mounted on high towers, a{steel fence and a{'micro' fence.}If any one gets over this it triggers an{alarm}and { {floodlights}come on. Built in{1960}to supply steel works in{Sheffield}and{Rotherham,}power is collected from local power stations {eg.Barnby Dun, Thorpe Marsh,}and sent to all parts of the country, but mainly to the south. During{1985}it is being extended so that it can receive {400,000 volts }instead of the{275,000 {volts}at present. The C.E.G.B. has a good safety record. Injuries from electricity are very rare indeed.
